books.title: Principia Ethica
books.author: G. E. Moore
books.summary: An analysis of the concept of good that diagnoses the history of ethics as being marred by the “naturalistic fallacy” while discussing intrinsic goods and evils.

books.title: The Door with Seven Locks
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A soon-to-retire Scotland Yard investigator, insulted when asked to investigate the theft of a library book, finds that it’s a case he can’t put down.

books.title: The Autobiography of Benjamin Franklin
books.author: Benjamin Franklin
books.summary: Benjamin Franklin writes about his youth, adventures, and achievements.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Pollyanna Grows Up
books.author: Eleanor H. Porter
books.summary: Pollyanna recovers from an automobile accident with the help of a nearby dowager, before leaving the country to later return to rural Vermont.

books.title: The Conscious Lovers
books.author: Richard Steele
books.summary: A rich young man tries to avoid the marriage his father has arranged.

books.title: The Man of Destiny
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Napoleon engages in a battle of wits to reclaim some stolen letters.

books.title: Five Children and It
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Five children encounter an ancient magical creature who grants them wishes—all of which go comically wrong.

books.title: The Melody of Death
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A recently disinherited man-about-town devises a scheme to provide for his newly wedded wife.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: The complete U.S. public domain short fiction of horror legend H. P. Lovecraft.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries.

books.title: Bulfinch’s Mythology
books.author: Thomas Bulfinch
books.summary: An American classicist collects and explains myths and legends ranging from those of the ancient Greeks and Romans, through stories of King Arthur, to the legends of Charlemagne.

books.title: Women and Economics
books.author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman
books.summary: Gilman explores the transformation of the role of women in society and the necessity for women to achieve economic independence.

books.title: Nonsense Books
books.author: Edward Lear
books.summary: A collection of literary nonsense in the forms of limericks, songs, and short stories.

books.title: Captain Jinks, Hero
books.author: Ernest Howard Crosby
books.summary: A jingoistic military officer embarks on a tragicomic quest to become a “perfect soldier.”

books.title: The Big Time
books.author: Fritz Leiber
books.summary: A motley collection of servicemembers escape a plot as two mysterious factions wage an epic war across time itself.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Gustave Flaubert
books.summary: A collection of short stories by Gustave Flaubert.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.

books.title: Three Men in a Boat
books.author: Jerome K. Jerome
books.summary: The humorous travelogue of a boating holiday down the Thames taken by three friends and their dog.
